author: Gerard Baker
title: The 10-Point.
text:
Good morning,
Doing Just Fine
Facebook is a hard friend to dump, even when it has it coming. The social network’s first-quarter earnings report Wednesday—its first since touching off widespread data-privacy concerns—showed that about 48 million daily active users signed up during the period. That was up 3.4% from the December quarter and was in line with Wall Street’s expectations. Facebook also posted soaring revenue and profit. The company has weathered one crisis after another in the 17 months since the 2016 presidential...
